1: So these three men stopped answering Job because he was righteous in his own eyes.
2: Then was kindled the anger of Elihu son of Barakel the Buzite, of the family of Ram; it was kindled against Job because he justified himself rather than God.
3: Elihu's anger was also kindled against his three friends because they had found no answer to Job, and yet they had condemned Job.
4: Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because the other men were older than he.
5: However, when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouths of these three men, his anger was kindled.
6:
Then Elihu son of Barakel the Buzite spoke up and said,\q "I am young, and you are very old.
\q That is why I held back and did not dare to tell you my own opinion.
\q
7:
I said, "Length of days should speak;\q a multitude of years should teach wisdom.


\q
8:
But there is a spirit in a man;\q the breath of the Almighty gives him understanding.
\q
9:
It is not only the great people who are wise,\q nor the aged people alone who understand justice.
\q
10:
Therefore I say to you, 'Listen to me;\q I will also tell you my knowledge.'


\q
11:
See, I waited for your words;\q I listened to your arguments
\q while you were thinking about what to say.
\q
12:
Indeed, I paid attention to you,\q but, see, there was not one of you who could convince Job
\q or who could respond to his words.


\q
13:
Be careful not to say, 'We have found wisdom!'\q God will have to defeat Job; mere man cannot do it.
\q
14:
For Job has not directed his words against me,\q so I will not answer him with your words.


\q
15:
These three men are dumbfounded; they can answer Job no longer;\q they have not a word more to say.
\q
16:
Should I wait because they are not speaking,\q because they stand there silent and answer no more?


\q
17:
No, I also will answer on my part;\q I will also tell them my knowledge.
\q
18:
For I am full of words;\q the spirit in me compels me.
\q
19:
See, my breast is like fermenting wine that has no vent;\q like new wineskins, it is ready to burst.


\q
20:
I will speak so that I may be refreshed;\q I will open my lips and answer.
\q
21:
I will not show favoritism;\q neither will I give honorific titles to any man.
\q
22: For I do not know how to give such titles;\q if I did so, my Maker would soon take me away.
